name: Afghanistan
interestingFact: since the use of the first flag in 1709, Afghanistan has had 26 different flags?

name: Albania
interestingFact: Albania is the world’s largest hydroelectricity producer? 100% of the country’s energy is hydroelectric.

name: Algeria
interestingFact: Algeria is the largest African nation, spread across more than 2 million square kilometres?

name: Andorra
interestingFact: the country of Andorra can fit into the City of London more than three times?

name: Angola
interestingFact: Angola has a shortage of men, so common practice for a man is to have several wives?

name: Antigua
interestingFact: Antigua has no rivers and no lakes?

name: Argentina
interestingFact: Argentina government banned parents from naming their children after Messi, worrying about confusion later down the line if the name was to become too fashionable?

name: Australia
interestingFact: Indian Pacific train has the longest straight section of train track in the world?

name: Austria
interestingFact: Vienna has the oldest zoo in the world which was founded in 1752?

name: Azerbaijan
interestingFact: Azerbaijan has the museum with the world’s largest collection of miniature books with more than 5,500 teeny tiny books on display?

name: Bahamas
interestingFact: the Bahamas is home to its own sea monster? It can change color, and it’s been described as “half-shark and half-octopus!

name: Bahrain
interestingFact: Bahrain was historically famed for its pearl fisheries, which were considered to be among the best in the world?

name: Bangladesh
interestingFact: in Bangladesh you commit a crime if you leave the house without wearing underwear?

name: Barbados
interestingFact: Barbados is the birthplace of rum? Mount Gay Distilleries has been churning out rum since 1703.

name: Belarus
interestingFact: Belarusians love a good superstition? A particularly popular one is that you should never whistle in your house or you’ll blow all your money away.

name: Belgium
interestingFact: until the 1970s, in Belgium light beer was served during school lunch?

name: Belize
interestingFact: many Belizeans avoid swimming in the ocean or rivers on Good Friday? It is viewed as bad luck. Local Mothers can often be heard telling their kids they “will turn fish!” if they swim on this day!

name: Bermuda
interestingFact: Bermuda is the Shipwreck Capital of the World? To date, over 300 wrecks have been found dating back to the 1600s.

name: Botswana
interestingFact: Botswana is one of the World’s biggest diamond producers?

name: Brazil
interestingFact: Brazil has the biggest carnival in the world? The Rio Carnival in Rio de Janeiro sees 2 million people.

name: Brunei
interestingFact: Brunei has one of the highest car-ownership rates in the world? The Sultan of Brunei alone owns five thousand cars.

name: Bulgaria
interestingFact: Bulgarians express approval by shaking their heads rather than nodding? Weird, huh.

name: Burkina Faso
interestingFact: the people love the horses in Burkina Faso? The White Stallion is the country’s national symbol.

name: Burundi
interestingFact: the traditional beer is drunk from one central pot by almost a dozen people using long straws?

name: Bhutan
interestingFact: Paro is known as the most dangerous airport to land on in the whole world? Only 8 trained pilots are allowed to do this.

name: Cambodia
interestingFact: spiders, scorpions, snakes, insects like maggots, cockroaches, and crickets are all cooked up and eaten in Cambodia?

name: Canada
interestingFact: Canada has the longest coastline and the longest international border in the world?

name: Cape Verde
interestingFact: in Cape Verde it is rude to eat in public without sharing your food?

name: Cayman Islands
interestingFact: in Cayman Islands is a dive site for every day of the year?

name: Chad
interestingFact: Chad has over 200 ethnic groups, and 100 languages are spoken?

name: Chile
interestingFact: the Atacama Desert is one of the driest places in the world? There are areas that go hundreds of years without receiving any rain at all.

name: China
interestingFact: the mortar used to bind the Great Wall’s stones was made with sticky rice?

name: Colombia
interestingFact: Colombia has a naturally occurring Rainbow River whose aquatic plants and algae have created a red, blue, orange, yellow, and green flowing stream?

name: Comoros
interestingFact: Comoros has one of the smallest populations in the world and is one of the most densely populated countries in the world?

name: Congo
interestingFact: the Congo River is the deepest river (220 m) in the world?

name: Costa Rica
interestingFact: Costa Rica does not have a standing army?

name: Croatia
interestingFact: Croatia is home to the world’s smallest town? According to sources it has a population of between 17 and 23!

name: Cuba
interestingFact: Cuba is home to the smallest bird in the world? The bee hummingbird grows to 6 cm in length!

name: Curacao
interestingFact: there’s not one person that has visit Curacao and not seen an iguana? They’re everywhere and are protected.

name: Cyprus
interestingFact: Cyprus is home to the oldest manufactured wine in the world? Is a sweet dessert wine and you can trace its origins as far back as 2000BC.

name: Czechia
interestingFact: the Czechia has the highest castle-density in the world? Get your fix of medieval charm with more than 2,000 around the country!

name: Denmark
interestingFact: the Danish language has no word for please?

name: Dominica
interestingFact: Sulfur springs and black-sand beaches surround the capital city of Roseau?

name: Dominican
interestingFact: it is  illegal to kiss a woman in front of a police officer?

name: Timor
interestingFact: Dugongs are considered sacred animals to locals, and are not hunted?

name: Ecuador
interestingFact: Ecuador’s highest mountain, Mount Chimborazo, at its peak is the furthest point from the Earth’s center?

name: Egypt
interestingFact: the 365-day calendar that is divided into 12 months was invented in Egypt?

name: El Salvador
interestingFact: it is considered polite to leave a small amount of food on your plate when you’ve finished eating?

name: England
interestingFact: in England, it’s illegal to get drunk in a pub?

name: Eritrea
interestingFact: one of the oldest human skeletons was discovered in Eritrea? A one-million-year-old hominid skull was found near the village of Buia.

name: Estonia
interestingFact: in Estonia wife-carrying is a sport?

name: Eswatini
interestingFact: Eswatini has two capital cities? Mbabane is the administrative capital while Lobamba is the national capital.

name: Ethiopia
interestingFact: Ethiopians measure the hours of a day to a different schedule? The clock starts when the day does. Thus, sunrise is 1 o’clock and sunset 12.

name: Finland
interestingFact: in Finland, they have ‘National Sleepy Head Day’, where the last person in a family to wake up is thrown into a lake by the rest of the family?

name: France
interestingFact: the French army still use carrier pigeons?

name: Gabon
interestingFact: the Gabonese people use masks to praise the ancestors and to mark important life events by signifying transformation?

name: Gambia
interestingFact: during elections, Gambians vote using marbles? They simply drop their marble into the hole of candidate they choose.

name: Georgia
interestingFact: the world’s deepest cave is found in Georgia? Veryovkina Cave  reaches a depth of 2,212 metres!

name: Germany
interestingFact: there is no speed limit on the highways in Germany?

name: Ghana
interestingFact: that coffins in Ghana have unique shapes such as lions, fish, crabs, shoes and airplanes?

name: Guam
interestingFact: there is no sand on the island of Guam? The beaches are covered in coral instead of sand, and paved roads in Guam are made by mixing coral and cement.

name: Guatemala
interestingFact: Guatemalans invented the first ever chocolate bar?

name: Guinea
interestingFact: in the Nimba Mountains of Guinea  chimpanzees were first observed using tools to chop up and reduce food into smaller bite-sized portions?

name: Guyana
interestingFact: Guyana is home to the world’s largest single drop waterfall? The Kaieteur Falls has a total length of 251 meters!

name: Haiti
interestingFact: Voodou still is a regular practice in Haiti?

name: Honduras
interestingFact: local buses are called Chicken buses? They’re brightly painted and look like a party on wheels. You’re unlikely to see chickens on these buses.

name: Hong Kong
interestingFact: the mystical art of feng shui remains common practice in Hong Kong? The rooftop of Central’s HSBC Hong Kong building includes two rods to deflect bad energy.

name: Hungary
interestingFact: Budapest has the highest number of thermal springs in the world?

name: India
interestingFact: Rajasthan has a Temple of Rats?

name: Indonesia
interestingFact: Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world?  Officially, there are over 17,500 islands that comprise Indonesia.

name: Iran
interestingFact: the weekend in Iran is Thursday and Friday? Thursday is like Saturday, banks and shops are open but some offices are closed, while Friday is like Sunday.

name: Iraq
interestingFact: it is offensive to eat with the left hand in Iraq?

name: Ireland
interestingFact: Ireland is one of the rare places in the world where you can’t find any snakes?

name: Italy
interestingFact: the Ortona town in Italy has a free wine fountain that flows 24-hours a day with locally grown red wine?

name: Israel
interestingFact: Israel has not only the lowest place is the world (the dead sea), but also World's lowest freshwater reservoir, the sea of Galilei?

name: Japan
interestingFact: in Japan it’s considered inappropriate to blow your nose in public?

name: Kazakhstan
interestingFact: half of Lake Balkhash, one of the largest lakes in the world, consists of fresh water, the other half of the salt water?

name: Kenya
interestingFact: Kenya’s Lamu Island, located off the northeast coast, is car-free?

name: Kiribati
interestingFact: Kiribati is the first country in the world to ring-in the New Year?

name: Kosovo
interestingFact: the national anthem of Kosovo, has no lyrics?

name: Kuwait
interestingFact: camel racing is popular in Kuwait and since 2005 races using robots as jockeys after children were banned from the sport?

name: Kyrgyzstan
interestingFact: Kyrgyzstan produced the longest poem in history? The Epic of Mana has 500,000 lines!

name: Lebanon
interestingFact: Lebanon is one of the world’s oldest countries with thousands of years of history?

name: Lesotho
interestingFact: Lesotho has the “highest lowest point” of any country. No other nation can claim a base altitude as lofty as 1,400m!

name: Libya
interestingFact: over 90% of Libya is desert or semidesert?

name: Liechtenstein
interestingFact: Liechtenstein’s capital city, Vaduz has a population of around 5,425, and the largest city in the country has population of 6008 people?

name: Lithuania
interestingFact: Lithuania is that they celebrate not one but two independence days? Each one commemorates a break from external rule.

name: Macau
interestingFact: Macau is 100% urbanised and is the number one most highly densely populated country in the world?

name: Macedonia
interestingFact: until the modern era (mid 20th century) Macedonian was only a spoken language?

name: Madagascar
interestingFact: Madagascar  men and women wear the same clothes? It is a rectangular length of cloth wrapped around the body.

name: Malawi
interestingFact: a  2.5 million years old hominid jawbone was discovered in Malawi? This is the oldest evidence of the genus Homo ever discovered.

name: Malaysia
interestingFact: Malaysia follows a unique rotating monarchy system? According to which nine ethnic Malay state rulers take turns to become the king for a term of five years.

name: Mali
interestingFact: Mansa Musa, who was king of the Mali Empire from 1280 to 1337, is believed to be the wealthiest man who has ever lived?

name: Malta
interestingFact: the crime rate in Malta is close to negligible? No matter your gender or age, you will always feel safe anywhere you go.

name: Morocco
interestingFact: meals in Morocco are commonly eaten with your hand instead of a fork or spoon? Just remember, use only the right hand to eat!

name: Mauritania
interestingFact: Mauritania has one of the longest trains in the world? The “Iron-ore Train” or “Train du Desert” is frequently 2.3km long!

name: Mauritius
interestingFact: Mauritius is known for its underwater waterfall, which is in fact an optical illusion? The underwater currents off the coast of Le Morne Brabant mountain create the impression of a huge underwater waterfall.

name: Mexico
interestingFact: Mexico  home to the world’s smallest volcano – Cuexcomate? This volcano sits just outside the city of Puebla and stands a cute 13.1 meters tall, barely a small hill.

name: Mongolia
interestingFact: approximately 25-40% of Mongolians still live nomadic lifestyles?

name: Montenegro
interestingFact: the birth of a son is a big celebration for the Montenegrins? In the countryside, people can be celebrating this event “in a big way” in front of the house with constant shots from pistols!

name: Mozambique
interestingFact: Mozambique population is incredibly young? An estimated 45 percent of the population is under 15 years of age1

name: Myanmar
interestingFact: the national dish of Burma is made of Tea? Tea Salad is a popular dish, which is the unofficial national food.

name: Nauru
interestingFact: Nauru as the world’s most obese nation with 88.5% of its population over 18 years old classified as obese?

name: Nepal
interestingFact: Nepal is possessing 8 peaks of the 10 highest in the world with Mount Everest among them?

name: Netherlands
interestingFact: almost one third of the Netherlands is below sea level, and even 60 percent of the population lives 5 metres below sea level?

name: New Zealand
interestingFact: in New Zealand lives Weta, the largest insect in the world? It  has ears on its knees, loves carrots and weighs in at 70g

name: Nicaragua
interestingFact: there are no street names in Nicaraguan towns and cities; instead, people give directions based on local landmarks?

name: Nigeria
interestingFact: in Nigeria in total more than 500 different languages are spoken?

name: Norway
interestingFact: Norwegians invented skiing some 4000 years ago? The island of Rødøy, in northern Norway, is home to rock carvings of that dates back 4000 years.

name: Oman
interestingFact: Oman is also one of the oldest human-inhabited places on the planet? It is estimated that humans have been living in the country for at least 106,000 years.

name: Pakistan
interestingFact: Pakistan has the largest canal-based irrigation system in the world?

name: Palau
interestingFact: Palau is home to Jellyfish Lake? A land-locked marine lake filled with 5 million non-stinging transparent jellyfish that swim en masse to follow the path of the sun.

name: Palestine
interestingFact: Palestine is home to the oldest olive trees in the world, which date back nearly 4,000 years?

name: Papua New Guinea
interestingFact: Papua New Guinea is home to the one of Earth’s very few poisonous birds?

name: Peru
interestingFact: Roasted guinea pig is the national dish of Peru? It is served whole – head and feet intact!

name: Philippines
interestingFact: Filipinos do not say ‘no’ or outright refuse an invitation or suggestion?

name: Poland
interestingFact: Poland is home to the world’s biggest castle? The Castle of the Teutonic Order in Malbork is the largest castle in the world by land area.

name: Portugal
interestingFact: Portugal is home to the world’s largest cork forest and produces over 70% of its cork exports?

name: Puerto Rico
interestingFact: Puerto Rico has the brightest bioluminescent bay in the world?

name: Qatar
interestingFact: Qatar has less than 10 days with rain per year, on average?

name: Romania
interestingFact: heaviest building in the world is in Romania? The Palace of Parliament in Bucharest contains 700,000 tonnes of steel and bronze, 1,000,000 square feet of marble.

name: Rwanda
interestingFact: once a month all Rwandans  have to work within their community sectors on various public works projects?

name: Solomon Islands
interestingFact: the world's largest raised coral atoll is East Rennell in the Solomon Islands?

name: Samoa
interestingFact: The world's largest raised coral atoll is East Rennell in the Solomon Islands?

name: Saudi Arabia
interestingFact: Saudi Arabia is the largest country in the world without a river? Most of the fresh water here comes from desalinization plants or underground reservoirs.

name: Scotland
interestingFact: Scots invented golf with St Andrews considered as the ‘home of golf’?

name: Senegal
interestingFact: Senegal has an island made of seashells? Houses, pathways and even graveyards on Fadiouth are made from seashells!
